meanings.definition: provoke or annoy (someone) so as to stimulate some action or reaction
meanings.sent1: The teasing goaded him into finally speaking up.
meanings.sent2: She goaded her friend to try the new roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel goaded the dog into chasing it around the yard.
meanings.sent4: His competitive spirit was goaded by the challenge to run faster.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk goaded the team to give their all in the game.

meanings.definition: a spiked stick used for driving cattle
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a goaded to guide the cows to the pasture.
meanings.sent2: She held the goaded firmly while leading the herd.
meanings.sent3: The old goaded had been passed down through generations of farmers.
meanings.sent4: The shiny goaded gleamed in the sunlight as it was used to direct the animals.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the goaded tapping on the ground echoed across the field.
